intro_text: As the patrol is marking the border lines, a gang of rogues leaps out from behind a tumble of rocks! An ambush!
decline_text: The patrol turns tail and races away! The borders are left open for the rogues to muddy.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol descends into battle without a second thought, easily driving the rogues away as they use their knowledge of the rocky terrain to their advantage.

s_c immediately leaps to protect their Clanmates. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} ferocity in battle terrifies the rogues. Realizing that they've sorely underestimated the Clan slugcats, the rogues turn tail and run.
s_c revels in the battle, leaping into the fray with {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth bared and claws unsheathed. The rogues are quickly driven away by the patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: The rogues are terrifyingly coordinated and use the patrol's shock and confusion against them. The patrol slugcats are picked off one by one, and only a couple manage to escape the slaughter.

history_text.scar: m_c was badly scarred when rogues ambushed {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} patrol.
history_text.reg_death: This slugcat was killed when rogues ambushed {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} patrol.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed in a rogue ambush

fail_outcomes.text: Taken by surprise, the patrol scatters and loses cohesion. The rogues are quick to take advantage of the confusion, and eventually the patrol retreats, r_c badly wounded.

history_text.scar: m_c was badly scarred when rogues ambushed {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} patrol.
history_text.reg_death: This slugcat was killed when rogues ambushed {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} patrol.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed in a rogue ambush

intro_text: As the patrol is marking the border lines, a gang of rogues leaps out from behind a tumble of rocks! An ambush!
decline_text: r_c turns tail and races away! The rogues have {PRONOUN/r_c/object} far outnumbered, and warning the Clan is more important than dying needlessly.

success_outcomes.text: Stunned for a moment, r_c is nearly caught in the teeth of the first rogue, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/use/uses} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} superior knowledge of the rocky terrain to dodge and weave through the onslaught of attacks, eventually escaping the fray and pelting towards camp with yowls of warning bursting from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} lungs.

s_c snarls at the rogues, outnumbered but not cowed. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/throw/throws} {PRONOUN/s_c/self} at the intruders with such ferocity that the rogues are taken aback. Alarmed by the Clan slugcat's lack of fear and self-preservation, the rogues freeze. s_c sees {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} opportunity to run and takes it, racing back to the camp to gather more warriors and return.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c snarls at the rogues, outnumbered but not cowed. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/throw/throws} {PRONOUN/s_c/self} at the intruders with such ferocity that the rogues are taken aback. Their shock only lasts a moment before they descend upon the warrior once more. Eventually, s_c has no choice but to escape before {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} killed.
The rogues greatly outnumber r_c and have no trouble killing the lone slugcat. {PRONOUN/r_c/poss/CAP} body is discovered the next day, cold and covered in wounds.

intro_text: As the patrol is marking the border lines, a gang of rogues strides confidently out from behind a tumble of rocks, yowling as they confront the Clan slugcats!
decline_text: The patrol turns tail and races away! The borders are left open for the rogues to muddy.

success_outcomes.text: The rogues posture and jeer, eventually provoking a battle. The Clan slugcats are strong, however, and the rogues seem to be weakened by hunger. The patrol easily drives the intruders away.
The rogues posture and jeer, eventually provoking a battle. The Clan slugcats are strong, however, and experienced at using the rocky terrain to their advantage, the rogues are forced to retreat.

s_c takes the lead, confronting the gang with confidence. Eventually the rogues admit that they've been struggling to find enough prey and were looking to steal richer territory from the Clan. Tensions are eased when s_c informs the rogues of a prey-rich meadow outside of c_n territory.

s_c takes the lead, confronting the gang with confidence. Eventually the rogues admit that they've been struggling to find enough prey and were looking to steal richer territory from the Clan. Tensions are eased when s_c informs the rogues of a prey-rich meadow outside of c_n territory.

intro_text: On their way to mark the far corners of their mountain, r_c starts telling a story of their ancestors to keep every slugcat entertained.
decline_text: A shadow flies over them, and r_c's storytelling is forgotten as the patrol makes sure it wasn't an eagle.

success_outcomes.text: It keeps the slugcats' minds off their sore pads and the sharp stones they walk on. The patrol goes quickly and easily.

s_c spins a vivid, engaging tale of a massive war their ancestors fought over the border the patrol is headed to mark. Not only does it keep every slugcat entertained, but it also emphasizes the importance of the patrol and motivates everyone.
It's a fantastic idea, making the patrol fly by as slugcats chat and laugh with their Clanmates, and everyone ends the day feeling much closer to each other.

fail_outcomes.text: The rocky terrain is too rough to keep up a story, and eventually r_c peters out, breathless and panting.
s_c takes r_c aside and reminds {PRONOUN/r_c/object} coldly to focus on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} duties.

intro_text: The patrol reaches a river that must be crossed to ensure the borders are thoroughly checked.
decline_text: p_l makes the decision to lead the patrol home instead; it's too risky today.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol crosses the river with careful determination, stepping from stone to stone. Wet paws don't slow the patrol down, and the border is secured without issue.

The patrol finds a shallow part of the river mostly clear of any large rocks. They wade through the river safely, and each slugcat stays close to each other to prevent any of them from being swept away.

As the patrol attempts to cross, a particularly nasty current rushes towards them. Acting fast, s_c navigates the current like a fish, assisting {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates to safety. The patrol hastily finishes securing the border and returns to camp a little shaken, but okay, thanks to s_c.

While attempting to cross, the patrol is overcome by a strong rush of water. Without thinking of {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own safety, s_c focuses on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} struggling Clanmates. s_c valiantly rescues the entire patrol and collapses from exhaustion on the riverbed. In awe of s_c's selflessness the patrol helps {PRONOUN/s_c/object} back to camp, and thanks to {PRONOUN/s_c/object} each one of them is alive.

fail_outcomes.text: Just as the patrol begins to cross, p_l yowls out a warning! The slugcats scramble out of the water just in time to see a large rush of water crash past them. Shaken by the close call, p_l instructs the patrol to head home early. The border will just have to stay unsecured and open to trespassers for now.

As the patrol sets out to cross, s_c stops them. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/see/sees} what the other slugcats miss, a dark current ready to pull any slugcat that dares to cross under. The patrol members cast uneasy glances at each other and unanimously decide to head home without crossing.

As the patrol sets out to cross, a chill runs down s_c's spine and whispers fill {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} mind. s_c yells out a warning to the patrol to stop, and the slugcats jump back, startled. Suddenly, a large branch sweeps down the river right where the patrol was crossing. s_c shakily whispers thanks to StarClan for their warning.

After some consideration, the patrol finds a place to cross. As they reach about halfway across, a strong rush of water crashes over them. The current pulls them from safety and churns them with no mercy. The slugcats are dashed against the sharp river rocks as they feebly try to cling to whatever they can. A mountain river is no place for a slugcat to be, and despite their best efforts, the cold water wins a battle that was over before it started.

history_text.lead_death: died trying to cross a dangerous river

After some consideration the patrol finds a place to cross. As they reach about halfway across a strong rush of water crashes over them. The water mercilessly crashes them against the river's sharp boulders and violently sends them careening over a small waterfall. Thankfully, at the bottom of the waterfall the water is calmer and they wash up on the riverbed, but not without the consequences of trying to fight one of nature's strongest forces.

intro_text: As r_c pads through the shadowy trees, the sun already hidden by the mountain slopes, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/freeze/freezes}. Up ahead, a Twoleg peers down from above, its black wings a huge backdrop to hypnotic, glowing red eyes...
decline_text: This is no creature for mortal eyes. r_c screws {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyelids shut, muttering prayer after prayer after prayer to StarClan itself - and when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/open/opens} them again, the moth-Twoleg is gone.

success_outcomes.text: r_c turns tail and runs, feeling air ruffle {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fur as something passes overhead while {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pelt/pelts} for home, without even the breath to waste on wailing.
r_c returns home from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} uneventful patrol.

Caution has always been in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} blood, and this, this has to be why. Frozen to the ground so completely that the frost grows over {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} fur as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/wait/waits}, s_c refuses to twitch so much as a whisker until the moth-Twoleg leaves.

fail_outcomes.text: All r_c remembers from then is the eyes... the glowing red eyes...
r_c doesn't return home.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was taken as the Mothman's snack.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} taken as the Mothman's snack

fail_outcomes.text: The vast moth-Twoleg flies off, and r_c tries to shake off the encounter - but the mountain itself seems to be against {PRONOUN/r_c/object} tonight, collapsing beneath {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} feet.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by the collapsing mountain slopes, an event predicted by the appearance of the Mothman.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by the collapsing mountain slopes after {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw the Mothman

intro_text: As p_l ducks through the overhanging branches of an evergreen, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/spot/spots} two rain deer, lying intertwined. Are they sleeping? Curious, p_l creeps closer.
decline_text: Two rain deer are incomprehensibly huge targets for slugcats. p_l moves on.

success_outcomes.text: The bigger rain deer raises its head, blood dripping from its lips, head lifting higher and higher and higher as it rears backwards, jaws dropping open in a blood curdling scream, one mirrored by p_l as p_l shrieks and runs.

fail_outcomes.text: The bigger rain deer raises its head, blood dripping from its lips, head lifting higher and higher and higher. p_l shrieks and runs, branches tearing through {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} pelt as, horrifyingly, something crashes after {PRONOUN/p_l/object}, chasing {PRONOUN/p_l/object} for a pawful of frantic heartbeats.

intro_text: r_c tracks the scent of a cyan lizard along the edge of the Clan's territory.
decline_text: r_c decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it hasn't crossed the border.

success_outcomes.text: r_c bolts back to camp, yowling a warning!

s_c sets up an ambush for the wandering lizard. When the lizard nears {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} hiding spot, s_c leaps out with spear in hand, bloodies its hide, and leads it on a wild chasing dance across the border and out of c_n territory.

r_c spots the nimble cyan lizard first, and pauses in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} fright. However, instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! r_c now has a story to tell about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} new friend!

s_c spots the nimble cyan lizard first, and pauses in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} fright. However, instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! s_c now has a story to tell about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} new friend!

{PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/do/does}n't feel like {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} the skill or power to take on a cyan lizard single-pawed, but s_c would give {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} life for c_n. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/charge/charges} in courageously to lead the lizard away from c_n territory. Each burst from it's tail could be the herald of their doom, each jump the last thing {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} might ever feel, but somehow, limbs and lungs burning, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} eventually {VERB/s_c/leap/leaps} to refuge.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c would give {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life to protect c_n, and as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/lead/leads} the cyan lizard away from the Clan, in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} heart, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/accept/accepts} that's what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} doing. As darkness closes in around {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and the lizard's jaws descend again, r_c tries to sink {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear into its hide, and hopes desperately that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} led it far enough.

Miraculously {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/fly/flies} out of the lizard's jaws while it shakes {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, landing safely. r_c is injured, desperate, and terrified - but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} alive.

intro_text: The patrol tracks the scent of a cyan lizard along the edge of the Clan's territory.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it hasn't crossed the border.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol shadows the cyan lizard, sending a message back to warn camp. It's an exhausting and stressful day, but by the time night falls, they've confirmed that the lizard is leaving the local area, and the patrol has assured c_n's safety.
The patrol gathers their courage and valiantly tries to lead away the cyan lizard. With such a small group of slugcats, they can only lead it a short distance, but it's better than nothing.
s_c sets up a careful ambush ahead of the cyan lizard, and {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} surprising, darting attack bloodies the lizard's flank, dissuading it from heading further into c_n territory.

s_c selflessly takes the scavenger's share of the run as the patrol leads the cyan lizard on, exhausting {PRONOUN/s_c/self} almost to the point of danger but leading the lizard far away from c_n borders. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} Clanmates support {PRONOUN/s_c/object} on the long walk home once it's all over, their purrs mixing with s_c's exhausted pants.

s_c spots the nimble cyan lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The cyan lizard follows s_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

r_c spots the nimble cyan lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The cyan lizard follows r_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch over the lizard from a distance, but it spots the slugcats and forces them to scatter. Everyone escapes just fine, but they lose track of the lizard. It could be anywhere - still out there, lurking, waiting to attack.

s_c tries to take the scavenger's share of the effort to lead the cyan lizard away, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} strength fails {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and the rest of the patrol needs to rescue {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, which cuts the patrol short. Everyone knows the lizard could still be lurking on their borders.

The patrol tries to lead the cyan lizard away from the Clan's borders, but with so few slugcats it's impossible to cover each other's backs. r_c falls to the lizard as the rest of the patrol runs for their lives back to camp, terrified out of their pelts and mourning their Clanmate.

history_text.lead_death: died to keep c_n safe from a cyan lizard

fail_outcomes.text: The cyan lizard was too quick, too aggressive! It didn't stop at killing one, it's deadly jaws closed around any scug in it's reach. The rest of the patrol flees, yowling their heartbreak and warnings to the clan.

intro_text: The patrol stumbles across a cyan lizard wandering through the middle of the Clan's territory.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature. c_n will just have to hope it doesn't come any nearer to camp.

success_outcomes.text: They decide that no slugcat is going to be surprised by this predator again, and the patrol shadows the lizard, sending a message to warn camp. With enough slugcats to keep watch, rest, track, and send messages back and forth, c_n is kept safe from the wandering lizard.

The patrol gathers their courage and valiantly drives away the cyan lizard. Together, working as one, and with all the strength of the Ascended behind them, the patrol harries the lizard. By keeping up a series of small skirmishes through the entire day, they drive it all the way off c_n territory.

s_c has just enough time to yowl out a plan, leading the whole large patrol in a skillful battle maneuver against the cyan lizard that protects the slugcats from the chance of injury. The lizard tucks tail and runs for more friendly lands.

s_c selflessly throws {PRONOUN/s_c/self} into the fight, and every time the cyan lizard tries to grab at {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} there with claws, fur puffed out to twice {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} normal size. With s_c defending them, the patrol drives the lizard off, yowling triumphantly.

s_c spots the nimble cyan lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The cyan lizard follows s_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

r_c spots the nimble cyan lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The cyan lizard follows r_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the cyan lizard from a distance, but it spots the slugcats and they have to scatter. It's not as bad as it could've been though; r_c manages to keep track of the lizard's position, and it doesn't come any further into c_n territory.

s_c tries to protect {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates, but it gets in the way of the attack. Without everyone committed to driving the cyan lizard off, the patrol has to fall back, but they do so in good order.

With so many slugcats all working as one, the cyan lizard started to get beaten back. But just as the tide of the fight seems about to turn, one lucky strike hits r_c, and those vicious jaws take {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to the Void.
